title-group.article-title: Marcel and Merleau-Ponty: Incarnation, Situation and the Problem of History

ref.mixed-citation: Descombes' sense (1979)
Kruks (1981)
Sichère (1982)
Schmidt (1985)
Merleau-Ponty's work (1951)
Silverman (1979)
Sartre's example (1966: 589 ff.)
Merleau-Ponty comments: '... one and the same project being given, one rock will appear an obstacle, and another, being more negotiable, as a means' (1962: 439; my emphasis)
Merleau-Ponty would appear to be responding here to Sartre's insistence on the freedom involved in my assuming an inferiority complex (1966: 576-582)
Descombes, V. (1979). Le même et l'autre. Paris: Éditions de Minuit.
Kruks, S. (1981). The political philosophy of Merleau-Ponty. Atlantic Highlands, NJ: Humanities Press.
Marcel, G. (1952). Metaphysical journal. Trans. B. Wall. Chicago: Regnery. French original, 1927.
Marcel, G. (1962). Homo viator. Trans. E. Crauford. New York: Harper and Row. French original, 1945.
Marcel, G. (1965). Being and having. Trans. K. Farrer. New York: Harper and Row. French original, 1935.
Marcel, G. (1967). Essai de philosophie concrète. Paris: Gallimard. Original edition, 1940, entitled, Du refus à l'invocation.
Marcel, G. (1977), Tragic wisdom and beyond. Trans. S. John and P. McCormick. Evanston: Northwest- ern University Press. French original, 1968.
Marcel, G. (1978a). Mystery of being. Vol. I. Trans. G.S. Fraser. South Bend: Gateway. French original, 1951.
Marcel, G. (1978b). Man against mass society. Trans. G.S. Fraser. South Bend: Gateway. French ori- ginal, 1951.
Merleau-Ponty, M. (1936). Être et avoir. La Vie Intellectuelle 45: 98-109.
Merleau-Ponty, M. (1962). Phenomenology of perception. Trans. C. Smith. London: Routledge and Ke- gan Paul. French original, 1945.
Merleau-Ponty, M. (1963). In praise of philosophy. Trans. J. Wild and J. Edie. Evanston: Northwestern University Press. French original, 1953.
Merleau-Ponty, M. (1964a). Sense and non-sense. Trans. H.L. Dreyfus and P.A. Dreyfus. Evanston: Northwestern University Press. French original, 1948.

Merleau-Ponty, M. (1964b). The primacy of perception and its philosophical consequences. In J.M. Edie (Ed.), The primacy of perception and other essays. Evanston: Northwestern University Press. French original of the paper, 1947.
Merleau-Ponty, M. (1964c). Signs. Trans. R.C. Cleary. Evanston: Northwestern University Press. French original, 1960.
Merleau-Ponty, M. (1966). La philosophie de l'existence. Dialogue 5(3): 307-322. Originally a lecture given in Paris, 1959.
Merleau-Ponty, M. (1969). Humanism and terror. Trans. J. O'Neill. Boston: Beacon Press. French ori- ginal, 1947.
Merleau-Ponty, M. (1974). Adventures of the dialectic. Trans. J. Bien. London: Heinemann. French ori- ginal, 1955.

Ricoeur, P. (1977). Conversations between Paul Ricoeur and Gabriel Marcel. In Tragic wisdom and beyond. Trans. S. Jolin and P. McCormick. Evanston: Northwestern University Press. French ori- ginal, 1968.
Sartre, J.-P. (1966). Being and nothingness. Trans. H. Barnes. New York: Washington Square Press. French original, 1943.
Schmidt, J. (1985). Maurice Merleau-Ponty: Between phenomenology and structuralism. London: Macmillan.
Sichère, B. (1982). Merleau-Ponty ou le corps de la philosophic Paris: Grasset.
Silverman, H.J. (1979). Merleau-Ponty's human ambiguity. Journal of the British Society for Pheno- menology 10 (1): 23-38.
de Waelhens, A. (1951). La philosophie de l'ambiguité. Louvain: Publications Universitaires de Louvain.
